hero.description: LINCE empowers water treatment companies to manage systems, log field data, conduct inspections, track incidents, and generate AI-powered reports — all in one place.
hero.trustedBy: Trusted by water management professionals across industries

stats.inspectionsDesc: Field inspections logged on the platform

about.title: The Platform Built for Water Management Professionals
about.description: LINCE (Monitoring & Inspection Control Engine) is a comprehensive SaaS platform designed from the ground up for water treatment operations. It unifies data collection, inspections, incident management, and AI analytics into a single intuitive system that improves operational control and ensures regulatory compliance.

pillars.title: Fully Configurable
pillars.desc: Create custom systems, monitoring points, parameters, and inspection checklists tailored to your exact operation.

pillars.title: Multi-Role Access
pillars.desc: Field technicians, managers, and administrators each have dedicated workflows and access levels.

pillars.title: AI-Driven Insights
pillars.desc: Claude AI analyzes your operational data to identify trends, anomalies, and provide actionable recommendations.

pillars.title: Audit-Ready Reports
pillars.desc: Generate professional PDF reports with photos, tables, charts, and digital signatures for compliance.

pillars.title: Modular Architecture
pillars.desc: Use only the modules you need — from basic daily logs to full inspection, incidents, and product management.

pillars.title: Industry-Specific
pillars.desc: Built specifically for water treatment, ETE, ETA, pools, cooling towers, boilers, and related industries.

profiles.title: LINCE Adapts to Your Business Model
profiles.description: Whether you manage your own facility or serve multiple clients, LINCE has a mode designed specifically for you.

endCustomer.title: For Industries & Facilities
endCustomer.description: Ideal for companies that manage their own water systems — factories, treatment plants, hotels, condominiums, and more.
features: Create and configure your own systems

serviceProvider.title: For Maintenance Companies
serviceProvider.description: Built for companies that provide water treatment services to multiple clients — pool companies, water treatment contractors, and consultants.

modules.title: Everything You Need, In One Platform
modules.description: From daily field data collection to AI-powered reports — LINCE covers every aspect of water system monitoring and management.

items.title: Systems & Monitoring
items.description: Create systems, monitoring points, and parameters. Track real-time data and set threshold alerts.

items.title: Daily Logs
items.description: Technicians log daily measurements organized by system, stage, and parameter for easy analysis.

items.title: Inspections
items.description: Structured inspections with custom checklists. Attach photos, mark non-conformities, track status.

items.title: Incidents & Occurrences
items.description: Report and track operational incidents with priority levels from open to resolved.

items.title: Chemical Products
items.description: Manage inventory, dosage records, and consumption tracking with low stock alerts.

items.title: Build Your Own Report
items.description: Drag-and-drop builder with custom blocks — analyses, photos, conclusions, digital signatures.

items.title: Document Library
items.description: Centralized repository for technical docs, lab reports, ARTs, certificates, and references.

items.title: AI Assistant
items.description: Claude AI analyzes data to generate insights, detect anomalies, suggest actions, and produce reports.

items.title: Dashboards & Charts
items.description: Interactive dashboards with line, bar, area, gauge, heatmap charts. Visualize data at a glance.

items.title: Smart Notifications
items.description: Automated alerts via email or SMS for out-of-range values, inspection deadlines, and more.

howItWorks.title: How LINCE Works
howItWorks.description: From initial setup to AI-powered insights — get your entire operation running on LINCE in days, not months.

steps.title: Configure Your Systems
steps.description: Set up your water systems, monitoring points, parameters with units and alert thresholds, and custom inspection checklists.

steps.title: Field Technicians Log Data
steps.description: Technicians access LINCE from any device to submit daily readings, perform photo-based inspections, and report incidents — all in real time.

steps.title: Managers Review & Control
steps.description: Managers get full visibility through dashboards, alerts, and detailed views. Review inspections, approve reports, and track compliance.

steps.title: AI Generates Insights
steps.description: Claude AI continuously analyzes your data to detect anomalies, identify trends, suggest corrective actions, and generate intelligent reports.

ai.title: AI That Understands Your
ai.description: LINCE integrates with Claude AI (Anthropic) to provide intelligent analysis of your operational data. The AI understands the context of water treatment and provides meaningful, actionable insights — not just generic statistics.
ai.note: AI features are fully optional and work seamlessly alongside the core platform. Add AI capabilities any time as your needs grow — with your own API key.

features.title: Trend Analysis
features.desc: Detect patterns across days, weeks, and months to predict equipment behavior and prevent failures.

features.title: Anomaly Detection
features.desc: AI flags values outside expected ranges automatically, even across multiple systems simultaneously.

features.title: Intelligent Reports
features.desc: Generate detailed reports with AI-written summaries, observations, and operational recommendations.

features.title: Smart Suggestions
features.desc: Context-aware suggestions based on current data — dosage adjustments, maintenance alerts, process improvements.

features.title: Cross-Period Comparison
features.desc: Compare parameters across periods, systems, and monitoring points to understand operational variations.

features.title: AI Chat Assistant
features.desc: Ask questions about your data in natural language and get instant, context-aware answers.

chat.title: LINCE AI Assistant
chat.subtitle: Powered by Claude · Context-aware for your water systems
chat.userMessage: What were the chlorine levels last week and are they within the normal range?
chat.aiPart1: Based on your ETA Unit A records from last week, chlorine levels averaged
chat.aiPart2: (range: 1.4–2.3 ppm). All readings were within the configured normal range of
chat.aiPart3: . However, I noticed a slight downward trend on Thursday and Friday —
chat.aiAmber: I recommend checking the chlorinator dosage settings
chat.aiPart4: to ensure levels stay above 1.5 ppm during peak hours.

serviceProvider.title: Manage All Your Clients
serviceProvider.description: If you provide water treatment services to multiple clients — condominiums, hotels, factories, or municipalities — LINCE's Service Provider Mode is built for you.
serviceProvider.hierarchyNote: The entire platform restructures around a
serviceProvider.hierarchyEnd: hierarchy, giving you full operational visibility while maintaining absolute data separation between clients.

benefits.title: Client Portfolio
benefits.desc: Register and manage all your clients in one place. Each client has their own dedicated workspace.

benefits.title: Strict Data Isolation
benefits.desc: Client A never sees Client B data. Every record is strictly isolated by client_id at the database level.

benefits.title: Fast Client Switching
benefits.desc: Switch between client contexts instantly. The entire system's working context updates automatically.

benefits.title: Per-Client Exports
benefits.desc: All reports and PDFs are always filtered by the selected client — no accidental data leakage.

benefits.title: Team Access Control
benefits.desc: Assign technicians to specific clients. Users only see the clients they have permission to access.

benefits.title: Professional Reports
benefits.desc: Generate branded PDF reports per client with your company logo, client details, and operational data.

reports.title: Professional Reports,
reports.description: Design custom report templates with the blocks you need. Generate branded PDFs with real operational data in seconds — not hours.
reports.featureTitle: From Template to PDF in One Click
reports.featureDescription: LINCE's report builder lets you create reusable templates for every report type — monthly visits, inspections, incident summaries, water analysis — then generate them instantly with real data from your systems.
features: Audit trail with user and timestamp

monitoring.title: Visualize Your Data, Act Faster
monitoring.description: Turn raw monitoring data into actionable insights with interactive charts, automated alerts, and cross-system analysis.
monitoring.alertDesc: ETA Unit A — pH: 8.4 (limit: 7.5) · 2 hours ago

features.title: Multi-Chart Dashboards
features.desc: Line, bar, area, gauge, radar, heatmap — configure your dashboard with the charts that matter most to your operation.

features.title: Automated Alert System
features.desc: Set thresholds for each parameter. When values go out of range, LINCE alerts the right people instantly via email or SMS.

features.title: Cross-System Comparison
features.desc: Compare the same parameter across multiple systems or monitoring points in a single view to identify variations.

features.title: Real-Time Status
features.desc: See the current status of all your systems at a glance — online, offline, alert, or maintenance — from the dashboard.

industries.description: LINCE is designed to handle the specific requirements of all water-related industries, with configurable parameters and workflows for each sector.

items.description: Process water monitoring for manufacturing, food processing, pharmaceutical, and other industrial facilities.

items.name: Buildings & Condos
items.description: Building water system management — storage tanks, distribution, drinking water quality, and compliance.

benefits.title: Built for Real-World Operations
benefits.description: Every feature in LINCE was designed based on real needs from water treatment professionals, not theoretical use cases.

items.title: Works on Any Device
items.desc: Fully responsive web app — desktop, tablet, and mobile. Technicians in the field, managers in the office.

items.title: Multi-Language
items.desc: Complete Portuguese and English interface. Switch languages at any time from the navigation bar.

items.title: Cloud-Based & Secure
items.desc: Enterprise-grade infrastructure with automatic backups, SSL encryption, and 99.9% uptime SLA.

items.title: Fast Performance
items.desc: Optimized with lazy loading, pagination, and image compression — even with large historical datasets.

items.title: Onboarding Support
items.desc: Interactive guided tours help every team member understand the system from day one.

items.title: Highly Configurable
items.desc: Everything is configurable — system types, parameter units, checklists, report templates, thresholds.

items.title: Photo Documentation
items.desc: Attach photos to inspections, incidents, systems, and documents. Stored securely on Cloudinary.

items.title: Smart Alerts
items.desc: Email and SMS notifications for out-of-range values, inspection deadlines, incidents, and updates.

security.title: Your Data is
security.description: Water treatment data is critical. LINCE is built with security as a foundational requirement — not an afterthought.
security.note: From SSL encryption to role-based access control and complete audit trails, every aspect of the platform is designed to protect your operational data and meet regulatory requirements.
security.complianceLine: Built for regulatory compliance in water treatment operations

items.title: SSL / HTTPS Everywhere
items.desc: All data transmitted between your browser and our servers is encrypted with SSL/TLS.

items.title: Client Data Isolation
items.desc: In service provider mode, every record includes client_id to prevent cross-client data leakage.

items.title: Role-Based Access Control
items.desc: Admin, Manager, and Technician roles each have specific permissions — users only see what they are authorized for.

items.title: Full Audit Trail
items.desc: Every generated report stores the user, date, applied filters, and template version for complete auditability.

items.title: Secure Media Storage
items.desc: All photos and documents are stored on Cloudinary with access controls, compression, and CDN delivery.

items.title: JWT Authentication
items.desc: Secure JSON Web Token authentication with session management and automatic expiration controls.

faq.title: Got Questions? We Have Answers.
faq.description: Everything you need to know about LINCE before getting started.

items.question: What is LINCE and who is it for?
items.answer: LINCE is a complete monitoring and inspection management platform for water systems. It is designed for two profiles: End Customers (companies that manage their own water systems like ETE/ETA stations, pools, cooling towers, boilers) and Service Providers (companies that provide water treatment services to multiple clients).

items.question: What is the difference between End Customer and Service Provider mode?
items.answer: In End Customer mode, the platform is organized as: Systems → Stages → Records/Inspections/Occurrences. In Service Provider mode, the hierarchy changes to: Client → Systems → Stages → Data. This allows service providers to manage multiple separate client portfolios with strict data isolation. You choose your mode during onboarding.

items.question: Can technicians use LINCE in the field on mobile devices?
items.answer: Yes. LINCE is a fully responsive web application that works on any device — desktop, tablet, and smartphone. Technicians can log daily measurements, conduct photo inspections, and report incidents directly from their mobile browser in the field.

items.question: How does the AI integration work?
items.answer: LINCE integrates with Claude AI (by Anthropic) to provide intelligent analysis of your operational data. The AI can detect anomalies, identify trends, compare periods, generate smart reports, and answer questions about your data via an interactive chat assistant. AI features are optional and can be enabled with your own API key.

items.question: Can I build custom inspection checklists?
items.answer: Yes. LINCE allows you to fully configure your inspection checklists — create custom items for each system or stage, mark them compliant/non-compliant, add comments, and attach photos. Checklist items are configured by managers and reused across inspections.

items.question: What types of reports can I generate?
items.answer: LINCE features a "Build Your Own Report" system where you create reusable templates by selecting blocks (branding, monitoring tables, inspection results, incident summaries, photos, digital signatures, attachments). Reports are generated as professional PDFs with your branding and real operational data.

items.question: Is my clients' data completely isolated in Service Provider mode?
items.answer: Absolutely. Every record, inspection, occurrence, photo, and report in LINCE is tagged with a client_id at the database level. This means Client A's data is completely inaccessible when working in Client B's context. Service provider users can only see clients they have been granted access to.

items.question: Can I try LINCE before purchasing?
items.answer: Yes. All plans include a 14-day free trial with full access to all features. No credit card is required to start. You can explore the entire platform, create systems, run inspections, and generate reports during your trial period.

items.question: What notifications does LINCE send?
items.answer: LINCE supports email notifications (via SendGrid) and optional SMS for: out-of-range parameter values, inspection deadlines, incident status updates, low product stock alerts, and custom system notifications configured by administrators.

items.question: Can multiple technicians use the same account?
items.answer: Yes. LINCE supports multiple users per organization with role-based access: Admin (full platform access), Manager (access to their systems and reports), and Technician (data entry and field operations). User management is available in all Professional and Enterprise plans.
